name: places/ChIJRVi2sLxYwokRP8AtahntGc8
formattedAddress: 300 E 87th St (2nd Ave & 87th, New York, NY 10128, USA
adrFormatAddress: 300 E 87th St (2nd Ave & 87th, New York, NY 10128, USA

originalText.text:
I picked the cheapest car rental option I could find in Manhattan. I paid for the car weeks in advance. I had essentially zero expectations.

I picked up the car on time. I think I was a few minutes early. The staff were helpful.

I got a car that I would still put in a different category than what I had a reservation for. Initially I was worried about fuel consumption, but it turned out that a) if I drove carefully, I could get an excellent mileage; b) the car was fast, so after a while I just didn't care.

The car worked well. I tried my best to take care of it. I would say that it was a great experience for me overall.

Since I had had the car for a while, I made sure to clean the inside of it before returning it. Doing so I found some fries, a chocolate bar of sorts, and tiny rocks under the carpets. My best guess is that all of those were in the car when I picked it up.
I did my best to get rid of them, refilled the tank, and returned the car. I was about 15 minutes late because man, Manhattan traffic is something.

I had paid with a debit card, so there was a deposit. I was told that releasing the deposit would take a couple of days. It happened about a month after I returned the car - this could have been my own bank's doing, I'm not sure. I did try to call Budget about this approximately 2 weeks in, but I couldn't reach them. In the end I didn't receive additional charges.

Be on time, be a little flexible, take care of the car; and judging by mine, I think you can have a great experience for a reasonable price.

originalText.text:
This is the WORST CAR RENTAL LOCATION OUTSIDE OF A WAR ZONE!!!!!  This is my second review.  Awful front desk person when I picked up my car at noon.  She said the gas tank was 3/4 full.  It Wasn't!
It was 1/4 full.  When I went back to her a few minutes later she argued with me.  What kind of car rental agency delivers a car to a customer with only a 1/4 tank???  You see they don't have a gas pump at the location, so the customer is SCREWED!!!  Budget doesn't give a damn about their customers.  Also, this location has tried to overcharge me at least twice.  Also, Budget customer service representatives are poorly trained.  I had to tell the reps how to do their job.  Find a car rental company Other than Budget!  Also, if you come on time be prepared to wait 45 minuted.  The location is understaffed.

originalText.text:
We used Budget's 300E 87 site in August. The car took no more than 15 minutes to get (I was 3rd in the line at 0730 on a Wednesday morning) and I was really happy with the service. thank you. I rented a Chevrolet Tahoe and was given a nearly new GMC Yukon. It was a great car.

The rental garage opens straight onto the road. If you're not used to driving in Manhattan, it's a baptism of fire (but great fun!)

originalText.text: Worst experience ever (not exacerbated). Picking up our car was very problematic. Systems didn't work so we couldn't get our car, the car was dirty, the amount of fuel in our car didn't correspond with what was promised. Handing in our car was a disaster too. The location we were supposed to hand in the car was unexpectedly closed. We had to find another location, which took us an extra day, so we got charged an additional amount of 20% of our total costs for being late and handing in our car in another location. During this whole period we couldn't get in touch with someone from the service center who was able to help us. We send multiple emails which we never got a reply to.

originalText.text: If I could give 0 stars, I would. Absolute worst car rental service experience I have ever had - avoid at ALL costs. The car we rented was scheduled for pickup at 6:30 PM. The workers made my husband wait an hour until the car was ready - at first they said they needed to find a guy to get the car, then the car was being 'washed'. After we made it to our destination, the car wouldn't start the next day. We had to call roadside assist because the battery had died even though the car was fully off all night. After 3 hours the battery was charged and we went to our 2nd destination, where the battery immediately died after we turned off the car AGAIN, making it obvious the battery in the car was completely shot. After several phone calls their customer service and a fully wasted day, they finally agreed to a full refund, only for subsequent random charges not matching the actual cost of the rental to be charged on our card afterwards. It took over 2 weeks and multiple calls to customer service to finally get credited back the full amount, until today (almost 4 weeks later), where they just charged my card AGAIN for the full rental cost they quoted that was supposed to be fully credited back. I have truly never had a worse experience with a company who is so unorganized and blatantly disregards their customers and their safety.
